content:
Course Notes - CS 260P - Fundamentals of Algorithms with Applications

The following documents outline the notes for the course CS 260P.

Note: All the notes are in PDF format. Viewing these files requires the use of a PDF Reader.

Notes by Lecture Schedule

  • 1: Introduction. Growth of functions. Basic data structures. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 1-7, with emphasis on Chapter 1.
    • Algorithm Analysis
    • AVL Trees
    • Heaps
    • Hash Tables
    • Union-Find Structures
  • 2: Sorting and Selection. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 8-9.
    • MergeSort
    • QuickSort
    • Insertion sort and Shell sort (Powerpoint)
    • Wikipedia article on Shellsort
    • Sorting lower bound
    • RadixSort
    • Selection
    • Random Number Generators (Powerpoint)
  • 3: Fundamental techniques. The greedy method. Divide-and-conquer. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 10-11.
    • Random Permutations (Powerpoint)
    • The Greedy Method
    • Bin Packing (Powerpoint)
    • Optional reading: Approximation Algorithms for Bin Packing
    • Divide-and-Conquer
  • 4: Dynamic programming. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapter 12.
    • Midterm I
    • Dynamic Programming
    • Telescope Scheduling
    • Game Strategies
  • 5: Dynamic programming and Graphs. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapter 13.
    • Longest Common Subsequences
    • 0/1 Knapsack
    • Graphs
    • Network Algorithms: Introduction (Powerpoint)
    • Depth-first search
  • 6: Graph algorithms. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 13-14.
    • Breadth-first search
    • Directed Graphs
    • Biconnectivity
    • Biconnected components
    • Shortest Paths
  • 7: More graph algorithms. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 15-16.
    • Midterm II
    • Minimum Spanning Trees
    • Network Flow
  • 8: NP-Completeness. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapter 17.
    • NP-completeness, Powerpoint
    • Satisfiability, Powerpoint
    • NP-complete Reductions, Powerpoint
  • 9: More NP-completeness and approximation algorithms. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapters 17-18.
    • More NP-complete Reductions, Powerpoint
    • Approximation Algorithms
  • 10: Randomized Algorithms and the Stable Marriage Problem. Reading: Goodrich-Tamassia, Chapter 19.
    • Randomized Algorithms
    • The Stable Marriage Problem
    • Skip Lists
    • Final exam


Michael T. Goodrich
Department of Computer Science
University of California, Irvine, CA 92697-3435 USA
